name: The smallest abundant number that begins a run of at least n consecutive abundant numbers with the same number of divisors.
example: a(6) = 733332 because 733332 is the smallest abundant number that begins a run of 6 consecutive abundant numbers (733332, 733338, 733340, 733344, 733348, 733350) with the same number of divisors, i.e. 24.

a(7) = 8547188 because 8547188 is the smallest abundant number that begins a run of 7 consecutive abundant numbers (8547188, 8547192, 8547196, 8547198, 8547200, 8547204, 8547210) with the same number of divisors, i.e. 48.
author: _Shyam Sunder Gupta_, Oct 05 2024
